intro: Eschscholzia juncea, commonly known as slender poppy, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that range in color from white to yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has a taproot system and lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The slender poppy is part of the Papaveraceae family and is known for its short blooming period in the spring.
